articles.title: What Left This Long, Winding Trail Across Mars? NASA’s Orbiter Has the Answer - SciTechDaily
articles.description: NASA’s Curiosity rover just made history with its first-ever mid-drive photo snapped from orbit, captured by the HiRISE camera aboard the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter. The image shows Curiosity trucking across the Martian surface, leaving a dramatic trail of t…
articles.content: NASA’s Curiosity rover appears as a dark speck in this contrast-enhanced view captured on February 28, 2025, by the HiRISE camera aboard NASA’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter. Trailing Curiosity are the… [+4160 chars]

articles.author: Jamie Carter
articles.title: Space photo of the week: Iconic 'Eagle Nebula' gets a major glow-up on Hubble's 35th anniversary - Live Science
articles.description: One of the Hubble Space Telescope's most iconic images has been reprocessed using the latest techniques.
articles.content:
What it is: The Eagle Nebula (Messier 16)
Where it is: 7,000 light-years away, in the constellation Serpens
When it was shared: April 18, 2025
